reviews.text: Great transport connections to get almost anywhere in the UK.  Just a shame that the rain pours through the roof, and some platforms are so covered in guano it feels hazardous to your health if you're stuck too long waiting for a train. And watch out for the seagulls.
A nice old style station with a pigeon population. I do love the roof
Needs more bathroom facilities. Waiting room is average, had flickering lights. Waiting outside on the platform was much better.

Bristol Temple Meads is my go to train station, having used it regularly going back and forth from London and Plymouth it is a place I have find myself at a lot. Very easy to get around and plenty of train times to choose from when regarding most major places. There has been a few issues surround signal interference or something when trying to get to my closet station but staff have always kept me up dated when asked. I would prefer if there was more room to sit and have a coffee because when travelling at peak times there often isn't much sitting room and can be a little annoying at times, but other than it is a good station.

An amazingly helpful young lady, Chloe, helped myself and a student find our way past all the magnetised gates. I would like to pass on my very sincerest thanks to all those who helped as I know it was as an unusual request, but they were all amazing! Especially Chloe!! Thanks for all your help and smiles.
